newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hitachi joins U.S. giants to develop server.
newsitem.headline: Hitachi joins U.S. giants to develop server.

text.p: Hitachi Ltd has agreed with Microsoft Corp, Intel Corp and Hewlett-Packard Co to jointly develop a next-generation computer server capable of running software based on both UNIX and Windows NT operating systems, a Japanese financial daily reported on Saturday.

The Nihon Keizai Shimbun quoted Hitachi officials as saying the company would develop technology for mass production by 1999 of the dual-format server at its Toyokawa plant in Aichi Prefecture, central Japan.
Hitachi and Hewlett-Packard were to begin sales of the next-generation server by 1999 and expected it to become the de facto global standard, the newspaper reported.
Hitachi expected to boost its year 2000 increase in sales by 10 percent with the new server, the financial daily reported.
Intel and Hewlett-Packard would develop the next-generation server, integrating the two different processors into a single unit, the daily reported.
A server controls and coordinates software application controls used by several computer terminals linked together in a network.
Presently, software used on Windows NT servers cannot be used on UNIX servers, and vice versa.
